chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S Bratten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CF499  Br. 3)  Atty. Romanowich withdraws motion to withdraw as counsel, Court orders motion withdrawn.  Counsel advises only able to resolve this case as 14CF499 is assigned to another attorney.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.   Guilty plea entered Ct. 3, Court dismissed Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 3 and enters judgment.
Hearing on November 25, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CF499 Br. 3) Counsel had filed Motion to Withdraw however have not determined that the defendant is not indigent.  Court denies Motion to Withdraw at this point.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Motion for Withdrawal of Counsel (withdrawn 11/25/14)
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing on November 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Counsel's 1st appearance; Motion to modify bond; Victim is present; Court has colloquy w/ victim; Court takes judicial notice of 11CM996, 11CM1029, 10CM781 & 13CM355; Statements from Victim; Argument from Defense; Statements from Def; Court denies motion for bail modification.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail Condition
14R 019694;   Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office
Maintain absolute sobriety; No contact with victim or her residence; One 20 minute visit in police company to obtain personal effects
Hearing on October 24, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not SPD eligible.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  State rqst. $750-1,000.00 cash bond, counsel states defendant does not have ability to post cash bond.  Victim also appears-Rebecca G.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Counsel advises defendant will now qualify for SPD due to cash bond and defendant being unable to post.    Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 09:45 am.
